text: Geotechnical report reviewed for water table elevation, infiltration rate, and soil permeability
Dewatering method (sump pump, wellpoint, deep well, or cutoff trench) selected and reviewed by engineer
Dewatering layout, discharge path, and erosion/sediment control measures approved
Pumps installed on level pad or suspended to prevent vibration/tilt
Discharge hoses, header pipes, and electrical connections inspected
Power supply (generator or panel) tested and labeled
Check valves and standby pump(s) installed if system is continuous-duty
Pump flow, head pressure, and drawdown rate monitored and logged daily
Sump pit maintained free of debris and sediment
Turbidity, pH, and flow volume monitored (if required by permit)
Ground settlement or trench instability monitored near dewatering area
Discharge location protected with sediment bags, filter socks, or vegetated buffer
Discharge path does not cause erosion, flooding, or backflow to excavation
Records maintained for municipal or environmental reporting (as applicable)
Pumps removed only after water table is confirmed stabilized and area dry
Sump pit and discharge path backfilled and restored as per site plan
